website_summaries.verdict: A nice-looking avocado slicer that is practical and good looking enough to make a nice gift.
pros: Wide scooping end helps get the meat out cleanly
Slices the skin and scrapes out the avocado without a problem
Smaller than other utensils and looks good
Works with other fruit and can be a great pumpkin cleaner
cons: This product does not have any kind of a handle to aid with holding

customer_reviews.title: Advocate for Avocado Slicer
customer_reviews.text: Some years ago I made this a gift to my wife, a skilled and innovate cook/chef at home. She said she'd have never bought this herself, finding she could do the job with a knife just fine. However, after using it once, she marveled at how much better it is than using a knife and uses this every time she wants to prepare a dish that uses avocados. This year I bought one for my college-age daughter because she lamented about not having one for times she wants to prepare avocados. And my younger daughter who will go to college in a few years has already informed me that this will be on a future Christmas list for her.
customer_reviews.author: Hondo

customer_reviews.title: Multitasker
customer_reviews.text: I know it's meant to slice avocados, and it does that fairly well according to family that use it; however, I got one because I loved how well it hollows out pumpkins. It's wider, flatter, and sharper than a spoon so it's perfect for hollowing out pumpkins.

customer_reviews.title: BEST avocado product on the market

I have given them for gifts and those friends and family love so much they started giving to their friends for gifts too.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe if you're left handed
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be my go-to avocado eating tool. Turned out to be not very handy: 1. The straight cutting part with the serrations is much less convenient than a regular serrated knife. 2. The small sharp serrated part for pitting - quite useless as far as my experience. 3. The spoon-like scooping part is pretty nice, more convenient than a regular spoon, but to hold it in a way you can use the spoon side, if you are right handed, you end up with your fingers on the straight sided serrated part. Not painful per se but inconvenient. All and all, I like avocado and wanted this tool to work, unfortunately it doesn't quite cut the cookie.
